title: Album Page, "Four Sketches of Architectural Elements in Profile, Pisa", late 19th century
medium: Graphite on very smooth, thin off-white wove paper, folded, tipped into binding with fabric
inscribed: Recto, in graphite, bottom right corner: 82; right side of sheet at upper left: full size; right side of sheet at lower center: Pisa; left side of sheet, counterclockwise from top: cornice; string course under window; arch window.  Verso of left side of sheet, in graphite, upper right: 94.
dimensions: Sheet: 30.6 x 41.6 cm (12 1/16 x 16 3/8 in.), irregular
description: Horizontal sheet folded vertically to make two equal size sheets, tipped into binding.  On the left side are three tracings of molding profiles: a cornice, a stringcourse, and possibly a window molding.  On the right sheet is possibly a smaller sketch of a full scale wooden bracket from Pisa seen in another sketch (1943-51-254). The sheet also has three horizontal creases from where it was once folded.

tombstone.epitaph: Album Page, "Four Sketches of Architectural Elements in Profile, Pisa", late 19th century.Graphite on very smooth, thin off-white wove paper, folded, tipped into binding with fabric. Gift of Mrs. William Greenough. 1943-51-255.
